intro: Plagiobothrys collinus var. pringlei, commonly known as the Pringle's bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many species with small, cruciform flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically linear and arranged alternately along the stem. This variety is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
